summary: A chat app where users talk to an AI about video games, with a new feature to have the AI build/generate games.

existing_features.title: Update the frontend ChatInterface and MessageBubble components to detect game-payload responses and render an interactive game directly inside the chat window. The game should appear in an embedded sandbox (e.g., an iframe with srcdoc or a canvas-based renderer) within the AI message bubble. Include a visible 'Play Game' label or title above the game area, and allow the user to interact with the game without leaving the chat.

Add gaming-themed prompt suggestions in the empty-state UI (ChatInterface.tsx) that hint at the game-building capability, such as 'Build me a Snake game', 'Create a Pong game', and 'Make a memory card game', so users discover this feature naturally.

new_feature_requests.summary: AI can build/generate games for the user

Extend the backend chat actor to detect when the user asks the AI to build or generate a game. When detected, the AI must return a structured response containing a self-contained playable mini-game (e.g., Snake, Pong, Memory Match, Breakout, or similar simple arcade game) encoded as an HTML/JS payload or a structured game definition that the frontend can render. The response must include a special marker or metadata field (e.g., a gamePayload field alongside the text message) so the frontend can distinguish game responses from regular chat.
